candidates.title: In Pictures: Shanghai Disneyland reopens
candidates.content:
Disney has reopened its Shanghai Disneyland park to a reduced number of visitors, ending a more than three-month closure caused by the coronavirus outbreak.
China has seen declining virus cases for weeks and has been gradually easing restrictions.
On Monday, it reported 17 new cases nationally - the highest daily increase since 28 April - bringing the total number of cases to 82,918, with the death toll at 4,633.
All photographs subject to copyright.
candidates.description: Visitors return to Shanghai Disneyland as it opens its doors for the first time in more than three months.

result.explanation: The provided text focuses on the reopening of Shanghai Disneyland after a three-month closure due to the coronavirus outbreak.  It offers no information about whether Disney kept interactive play areas and indoor live theatre shows closed. Therefore, the caption's claim cannot be verified or refuted using the given evidence. The evidence is reliable in describing the reopening but irrelevant to the caption's specific claim about closed attractions.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 describes the reopening of Shanghai Disneyland after a coronavirus closure but contains no information about the operational status of interactive play areas or indoor live theatre shows.
